[01-Oct-21 02:12 PM] ApexChat#8127
**ManoftheSea**:	Phobos, it is once again election time.  As ever, my platform is: Fund the CoGC, keep taxes low.  I'm now adding some funding of the SST to ensure there are enough Pioneers for growing businesses, but I am NOT funding anything higher than health with planetary funds.  If you want Techs or above, please work with private corps to do so. (to be fair, I'm feeding the PAR myself)


[01-Oct-21 02:14 PM] ApexChat#8127
**ManoftheSea**:	I also have settled a farming planet explicitly to ensure that we have the materials to keep the CoGC running.  While I keep an accounting of Phobos's budget on the UFO server in phobos-politics (currently, Phobos owes me 30k AIC or so), I will generally use market price as I feed it out of my own supply.  This insulates the planet from higher costs (at a time when supplies are finally coming back down).


[01-Oct-21 02:15 PM] ApexChat#8127
**ManoftheSea**:	When I say "insulates from higher cost", it means the planet will not lack RAT, PE, or MCG.  DW is slightly more difficult, but should be provided... even if prices hit the MM, it is only a budgetary concern, and I will eventually have to write off the planet's debt.  To you, citizen, you will still get the CoGC benefit.


[01-Oct-21 02:42 PM] ApexChat#8127
**alucard998**:	If anyone is interested in funding higher tier population, it came to my attention that the Library's educational bonus is worthless without Culture to back it up. As such, I believe I will be working on an Art Gallery. If you're interested in contributing to this project, please message me, either here or in Discord

[08-Nov-21 09:37 AM] ApexChat#8127
**ManoftheSea**:	Metallurgy is better done on Deimos.  There's a better source of FEO in the deimos system, and the CoGC on deimos means making FE and then STL is faster on deimos (and therefore cheaper).  However, the Phobos CoGC gives a benefit to then turn STL into PT.

[09-Nov-21 05:14 AM] ApexChat#8127

[02-Dec-21 08:42 PM] ApexChat#8127
**rain9441**:	Hello phobros.  I'd like to take the opportunity today to begin campaigning for the future of Phobos.  No, not as governor, as the Advocate for swapping our CoGC over from Manufacturing to Electronics.  This is not a war I plan to win in a day, but I am pitching the first battle now.


[02-Dec-21 08:42 PM] ApexChat#8127
**rain9441**:	Madnewmy and I have cast our votes for Electronics already, which puts it at a strong position.


[02-Dec-21 08:42 PM] ApexChat#8127
**rain9441**:	The neighboring planet, Antares I C, which I'm referring to as A1C for short, can be the future foundation for manufacturing.


[02-Dec-21 08:44 PM] ApexChat#8127
**rain9441**:	Manufacturing is primarily BMP and WPL for the low tier efforts.  For mid tier, it is PPFs and SCA/MCA.  For the high tier, it is basically only APF and AAF.


[02-Dec-21 08:44 PM] ApexChat#8127
**rain9441**:	The APF and AAF are not really built in enough quantities that they'll really need the boost.


[02-Dec-21 08:45 PM] ApexChat#8127
**rain9441**:	For PPFs, SCAs, MCAs, and WPLs, there is no planetary resource supporting those buildings on Phobos.  So those buildings can go anywhere.  The only building that has any benefit from local resources is the BMP when it makes MCG.


[02-Dec-21 08:46 PM] ApexChat#8127
**rain9441**:	As we move into the future, the SIO on Phobos paired with the AL from the AL capital of the universe, Deimos, next door, can combine here on Phobos to make SI and then TRN (in a CLR cleanroom).  TRN is used in high amounts.  The electronics expert bonus would be substantial for TRN production and this would let us sell TRN to the rest of the universe for a lot of money.


[02-Dec-21 08:47 PM] ApexChat#8127
**rain9441**:	Furthermore, we are in the unique spot where we have an N gas giant next door and an H gas giant in the system, lending itself for a double bonus if we have the SCA running on A1C.


[02-Dec-21 08:47 PM] ApexChat#8127
**rain9441**:	The SCA outputs a lot of SEN and PCB which is used in ELPs that can be housed here on Phobos with the 25% electronics boost.


[02-Dec-21 08:48 PM] ApexChat#8127
**rain9441**:	This is the very foundation of Drones, which are the highest tier and a hell of a market maker


[02-Dec-21 08:48 PM] ApexChat#8127
**rain9441**:	It also opens the way for Phobos to become the standard place to build software which will be in high demand when scientists are established (which is soon!)


[02-Dec-21 08:50 PM] ApexChat#8127
**rain9441**:	Long story short... Antares I C - Manufacturing (BMPs, WPLs, PPFs, and SCAs).  Phobos - Electronics (CLR, ELP, DRS, SE, SL).


[02-Dec-21 08:51 PM] ApexChat#8127
**rain9441**:	Only in Antares will we find this optimal chain for drone production - all within 1 jump of Phobos.


[02-Dec-21 08:51 PM] ApexChat#8127
**rain9441**:	Thanks for reading, love you all, steve holt!

[22-Feb-22 11:45 PM] ApexChat#8127
**DLR**:	Deimos is certainly a better metallurgy planet, though. The best one in the whole game I think. Smelters are expensive and efficiency goes a long way. The only benefit to doing it on phobos is the easy SIO extraction.


[22-Feb-22 11:53 PM] ApexChat#8127
**DLR**:	@Fairone if you are going to commit to EXT+SME here on Phobos (some would certainly advise against doing this) another thing you might consider is to add 1 COL and 1 INC. This will provide oxygen and carbon which will add a lot of versatility and lower operating costs for your smelting.


[22-Feb-22 11:54 PM] ApexChat#8127
**DLR**:	Also, these buildings are all considered resource extraction, so the EXT, COL, and INC would all benefit from the resource extraction experts.


[22-Feb-22 11:54 PM] ApexChat#8127
**DLR**:	For clarity, the smelter is a metallurgy building and does not benefit from resource extraction experts. Only metallurgy experts.

[12-Apr-22 03:02 PM] ApexChat#8127
**Yang_Mills**:	Hello! I tried to understand why the happiness of ENG and SCI on Phobos crushed to one digits with the last POPR (number 58). It was actually gradually eroding since report 53. So I had to dig a bit into how happiness works in PrUn. For this I relied on the PrUn community derived guide on mechanics. https://pct.fnar.net/population-infrastructure/

{Embed}
https://pct.fnar.net/population-infrastructure/
Population Infrastructure - PrUn Community Derived Information
Community derived data & formulas from the game Prosperous Universe


[12-Apr-22 03:03 PM] ApexChat#8127
**Yang_Mills**:	The key thing is that there are two types of happiness. The first type is the true happiness which depends on the unemployement/open jobs and need fulfilment during the week. This one is a hidden variable, not displayed anywhere. The second type is the average happiness. This is the one displayed. It's a weighted average of the ture happiness over the past 5 weeks. On top of that there are governor programs, Planetary festivities, that ad a constant value to the average happiness. But their effect is only for one week, no longer term effects. So because of the way the average happiness ingame is computed, there is a 5-week inertia to it.  It tried to infer from the date the value of the true happiness. Let's take the example of SCI. I assumed that up to and including POPR 52, the true happiness was, just as the average happiness, around 90 percent. From this I got that on POPR 53, the true happiness was about 67 percent, and starting from POPR 54 it crushed to one digits, like almost 0


[12-Apr-22 03:04 PM] ApexChat#8127
**Yang_Mills**:	Because of the way that average happiness is computed, we have seen the full effect of this only with the last POPR 58. But the fundamentals (true happiness) were already disastrous since POPR 54.


[12-Apr-22 03:04 PM] ApexChat#8127
**Yang_Mills**:	Actually POPR 53 is exactly when the Advanced education program III was enacted. Due to it, the number of SCI exploded from 226 to 785. So starting from the next POPR 54, there was a very high unemployment for SCI (74,5 percent). It crushed the hidden true happiness to one digits already on that week.

[20-Apr-22 05:46 AM] ApexChat#8127
**Yang_Mills**:	Greetings to all new players on Phobos! You chose this planet because the commodity exchange is in the same system, didn't you? You actually made a mistake! Phobos is by far not the most profitable starter planet. It is much better to start as a metalllurgist on Deimos and produce AL (aluminium), as a carbon farmer on Harmonia and produce C (carbon), or as a victualiser on Harmonia. Profits will be greater. Deimos and Harmonia are planets in the nearby systems, on or two jumps away from the CX (commodity exchange). But don't worry. You can just restart and set up your company anew. Use the COLIQ command.

Metallurgy or Construction is Deimos.

[20-Apr-22 11:56 AM] ApexChat#8127
**Yang_Mills**:	Greetings to all new players who settled on Phobos! You probably chose this planet because it's in the same system as the commodity exchange, it's fertile, it offers some oxygen, water and iron ore. Well, I have to disappoint you. You made a mistake and fell into a trap. Phobos is by far NOT  the most profitable starter planet in the Antares area. It's not that fertile, it doesn't have that much oxygen and offers very little water and iron ore. Deimos in the neighbouring system is much better for metallurgy, the best planet for this in the whole universe actually. It has a lot of oxygen, plenty of aluminium ore, and aluminium is in much higher demand than iron. Deimos also receives a metallurgy bonus from its Chamber of Global Commerce. Harmonia, a planet two jumps away, is much better suited for carbon farmers and victualisers. It's more fertile, has much more water, and its Chamber of Global Commerce provides an agriculture bonus.


[20-Apr-22 11:56 AM] ApexChat#8127
**Yang_Mills**:	You won't make much money as a starting player on Phobos. I would recommend you to liquidate your company and start a new one as a metallurigst on Deimos, or as a carbon farmer or victualiser on Harmonia. To restart, use the COLIQ command.


[20-Apr-22 11:57 AM] ApexChat#8127
**Yang_Mills**:	DON'T START ON PHOBOS! IT'S BAD!

[24-Apr-22 04:06 AM] ApexChat#8127

[24-Apr-22 04:16 AM] ApexChat#8127
**Blinder**:	Hey new players, please read the above explenations about this planet. it's far from suited for a starter planet. please consider COLIQ and start on a different planet so that you wount get discouraged and quit the game after few weeks


[24-Apr-22 04:17 AM] ApexChat#8127
**Blinder**:	i'll coppy and paste it here for your convenience:


[24-Apr-22 04:19 AM] ApexChat#8127
**Blinder**:	[OOG] Yang_Mills Greetings to all new players who settled on Phobos ! You probably chose this planet because it's in the same system as the commodity exchange, it's fertile, it offers some oxygen, water and iron ore. Well, I have to disappoint you. You made a mistake and fell into a trap. Phobos is by far NOT the most profitable starter planet in the Antares area. It's not that fertile, it doesn't have that much oxygen and offers very little water and iron ore. Deimos in the neighbouring system is much better for metallurgy, the best planet for this in the whole universe actually. It has a lot of oxygen, plenty of aluminium ore, and aluminium is in much higher demand than iron. Deimos also receives a metallurgy bonus from its Chamber of Global Commerce. Harmonia, a planet two jumps away, is much better suited for carbon farmers and victualisers. It's more fertile, has much more water, and its Chamber of Global Commerce provides an agriculture bonus.


[24-Apr-22 04:20 AM] ApexChat#8127
**Blinder**:	04/20 07:56 PM [OOG] Yang_Mills You won't make much money as a starting player on Phobos. I would recommend you to liquidate your company and start a new one as a metallurigst on Deimos, or as a carbon farmer or victualiser on Harmonia. To restart, use the COLIQ command. 04/20 07:56 PM [OOG] Yang_Mills DON'T START ON PHOBOS! IT'S BAD!


[24-Apr-22 04:20 AM] ApexChat#8127
**Blinder**:	04/20 09:20 PM [ANTS] Scorus As others are trying to tell you badly, Phobos can be challenging as a starting planet. If you are wanting to do metallurgy, then Deimos is a much better planet for you! If you want to be a carbon farmer or victualist, then Harmonia is much better! The discord channel is a great place to ask for advice from veterans.


[24-Apr-22 04:21 AM] ApexChat#8127
***Pudzhakov** left.*


[24-Apr-22 04:21 AM] ApexChat#8127
**Blinder**:	[GSO] ManoftheSea Well, it looks like there's a wave of new players. I am sad to tell you this, new players, but Phobos is not where you want to be. If you want to farm or make carbon, go to harmonia. If you want to make drinking water, Etherwind is the place to be. If you are a manufacturer, you want Hephastus. Metallurgy or Construction is Deimos.

[24-Apr-22 03:49 PM] ApexChat#8127
**DLR**:	Hello Citizens of Phobos, please observe this 7-days notice on a tax raise for pioneers.


[24-Apr-22 03:49 PM] ApexChat#8127
**DLR**:	The upcoming Phobos population report is expected to show a very large increase in pioneer population.   We predict that the comfort level of all workforces could fall badly in response. This would be very bad for our economy, which has benefitted from Phobos being a high tech electronics planet. We have already worked very hard to protect our scientist and engineer workforces from low comfort, which makes them flee the planet.  Despite this, we understand pioneers are necessary, and also need to avoid a situation where we have a pioneer and settler shortage on Phobos. That could lead to an even worse problem.


[24-Apr-22 03:49 PM] ApexChat#8127
**DLR**:	In response, OOG is urgently producing supplies to upgrade the PAR, and committing future POL time to supplying the DEC for this building. The cost for this upgrade is estimated to be 600k AIC at market rates, and in reality closer to 350k AIC as OOG will be able to supply some of it at low cost. Also, the DEC contributions could add up to 60k AIC weekly expense if fully funded.


[24-Apr-22 03:50 PM] ApexChat#8127
**DLR**:	If pioneer populations stabilize within range of our infrastructure comfort capacity, we will be able to lower taxes again in the future.  Without further ado, The new proposed tax structure for pioneers:


[24-Apr-22 03:50 PM] ApexChat#8127
**DLR**:	Low fees (15 AIC) for Resource Extraction, Food Industries, and Construction.


[24-Apr-22 03:50 PM] ApexChat#8127
**DLR**:	Medium fees (20 AIC) for Fuel Refining, Chemistry, and Metallurgy


[24-Apr-22 03:50 PM] ApexChat#8127
**DLR**:	High fees (25 AIC) for Agriculture and Manufacturing


[24-Apr-22 03:51 PM] ApexChat#8127
**DLR**:	Additionally for higher tier workforces, we are increasing the tax rate of electronics, because the profit margin is extremely high and the field benefits greatly from Phobos infrastructure.


[24-Apr-22 03:51 PM] ApexChat#8127
**DLR**:	Technician Electronics: 90 AIC -> 100 AIC


[24-Apr-22 03:51 PM] ApexChat#8127
**DLR**:	Engineer Electronics: 90 AIC -> 125 AIC


[24-Apr-22 03:51 PM] ApexChat#8127
**DLR**:	Scientist Electronics: 90 AIC -> 175 AIC


[24-Apr-22 03:51 PM] ApexChat#8127
**DLR**:	This will be put into effect in one week, pending slight adjustments after we are able to analyze the next POPR report


[24-Apr-22 03:52 PM] ApexChat#8127
**DLR**:	thank you for your time, and feel free to discuss here and on the UFO discord server. I am also available in direct message, but am generally very busy and sometimes do not respond quickly.

**LegalTaxEvasion**:	Does increasing the Pioneers satisfaction also increase the production rates and population?


[25-Aug-22 06:23 PM] ApexChat#8127
**Yang_Mills**:	It increases only the popultaion


[25-Aug-22 06:23 PM] ApexChat#8127
**Yang_Mills**:	more precisely the migration speed.


[25-Aug-22 06:24 PM] ApexChat#8127
**Yang_Mills**:	It does not increase the production rates.


[25-Aug-22 06:27 PM] ApexChat#8127
**Yang_Mills**:	Sorry, I ment the hapiness at plantary level.


[25-Aug-22 06:27 PM] ApexChat#8127
**Yang_Mills**:	As for satisfaction inside a base, it increases the production rates but not the population.


[25-Aug-22 06:29 PM] ApexChat#8127
**Yang_Mills**:	Satisfaction per base: increases production rates.


[25-Aug-22 06:29 PM] ApexChat#8127
**Yang_Mills**:	Happiness per planet: increases migration.


[25-Aug-22 06:30 PM] ApexChat#8127
**LegalTaxEvasion**:	Cool. Satisfaction per base: Increased production. And when you say per planet, thats the population pool that effects the other bases too, right?


[25-Aug-22 06:30 PM] ApexChat#8127
**Yang_Mills**:	Yes.


[25-Aug-22 06:31 PM] ApexChat#8127
**Yang_Mills**:	There is a planetary happiness level that you can see in the population report.


[25-Aug-22 06:31 PM] ApexChat#8127
**LegalTaxEvasion**:	Great. Thank you, I just got some back to base to test it and realized I could have asked instead of guessing.


[25-Aug-22 06:31 PM] ApexChat#8127
**Yang_Mills**:	Click on the population number and you will see the report.


[25-Aug-22 06:32 PM] ApexChat#8127
**Yang_Mills**:	The happiness level affects the planetary labor pool.


[25-Aug-22 06:32 PM] ApexChat#8127
**LegalTaxEvasion**:	Oh cool


[25-Aug-22 06:34 PM] ApexChat#8127
**LegalTaxEvasion**:	Is there ever a good reason to lose global population?


[25-Aug-22 06:34 PM] ApexChat#8127
**Yang_Mills**:	The planetary population needs upkeep.


[25-Aug-22 06:35 PM] ApexChat#8127
**Yang_Mills**:	If the excess of population is too large compared to the opne jobs,


[25-Aug-22 06:35 PM] ApexChat#8127
**Yang_Mills**:	then the happiness of the population will decrease beacause of the unemployment.


[25-Aug-22 06:36 PM] ApexChat#8127
**Yang_Mills**:	Wich might trigger emigration (migration off the planet).


[25-Aug-22 06:36 PM] ApexChat#8127
**Yang_Mills**:	And the population will decrease.


[25-Aug-22 06:36 PM] ApexChat#8127
**Yang_Mills**:	This is kind of a self-regulating system.


[25-Aug-22 06:36 PM] ApexChat#8127
**LegalTaxEvasion**:	That makes sense.

[26-Aug-22 09:57 PM] ApexChat#8127
**WhiteSaturnMath**:	guys how do i buy resources or get started?


[26-Aug-22 10:24 PM] ApexChat#8127
**Slomes**:	you will want to fly one of your ships to the Antares Commodity Exchange, and then purchase the goods there. You can find the CX (commodity exchange) on the left toolbar under CXL (which lists all CX in the universe). They are all somewhere in space, so you need to travel there. However there is also rentable Storage on site, which would allow purchasing (and selling if you have goods there) without a ship present.


[26-Aug-22 10:26 PM] ApexChat#8127
**Slomes**:	For flying there, just type "ANT" into the flight destination, then select the "Antares Station", which is a space station the CX is found on.

[31-Aug-22 12:54 PM] ApexChat#8127
**Oryinn**:	When considering shipping contracts and fuel costs, is there a way to find out multi stop fuel costs?


[31-Aug-22 12:55 PM] ApexChat#8127
**Oryinn**:	Or the costs of a ship to fly from point A to B when the ship is at C currently I guess


[31-Aug-22 12:59 PM] ApexChat#8127
**Rwinner16**:	use the BLU, and trace out the takeoff, landing from A -> B, then again B ->C


[31-Aug-22 01:00 PM] ApexChat#8127
**Rwinner16**:	it'll get you somewhat close.


[31-Aug-22 01:00 PM] ApexChat#8127
**Rwinner16**:	If B is on the flight path of A -> C, then just triple the landing SF usage that you see on A -> B, and you'll be within the error of margin


[31-Aug-22 01:01 PM] ApexChat#8127
**Oryinn**:	Sorry Im brand spanking new but what is BLU


[31-Aug-22 01:24 PM] ApexChat#8127

***userb1d408d75c** left.*


[14-Sep-22 11:26 AM] ApexChat#8127
***OmnisR** joined.*


[14-Sep-22 12:26 PM] ApexChat#8127
***JoBerg82** joined.*


[14-Sep-22 02:06 PM] ApexChat#8127
**BynceHb**:	What's the profit in producing infrastructure upkeep stuff? Like if i make security uniforms, don't i just donate it to the infrastructure?


[14-Sep-22 02:09 PM] ApexChat#8127
**Churaviis**:	The profit comes in maybe tax revenue, either by being in the same corp as the governor or by selling the product to someone that is, but mostly it comes by having enough workers to run your production lines at full efficiency.


[14-Sep-22 02:10 PM] ApexChat#8127
**BynceHb**:	So whoever donates more to the infrastructure gets more workforce from the common pool?


[14-Sep-22 02:12 PM] ApexChat#8127
**Churaviis**:	No, the workforce is doled out equally at POPR, but someone needs to donate the upkeep, otherwise there won't be enough workers for everyone.


[14-Sep-22 02:14 PM] ApexChat#8127
**BynceHb**:	Oh i see. I bet governors just produce this stuff by themself, judging by the market


[14-Sep-22 02:22 PM] ApexChat#8127
**Churaviis**:	Yes, items that only get used for upkeep tend to be too slow velocity to sell on the market and most governors are advanced enough to make it themselves or are members of a corporation that is or they make special agreements to buy it directly from producers.


[14-Sep-22 02:23 PM] ApexChat#8127
**BynceHb**:	Alright, I see, thank you


[14-Sep-22 02:47 PM] ApexChat#8127
**jelutz77**:	It could also be that you're maintaining the facility for a 25% bonus to productivity on a planet by yourself, or are running a huge base at a big savings per quantity.

[08-Feb-23 02:25 AM] ApexChat#8127
**62**:	Bonjour. Quelquun pourrait mexpliqer en franais le fonctionnement des contrats de logistiques ?


[08-Feb-23 03:22 AM] ApexChat#8127
**Domicius**:	c'est pour envoyer des choses (pardon pour mon francais)


[08-Feb-23 03:23 AM] ApexChat#8127
**Domicius**:	tu choisis le produit, le planete ou tu as le produit maintenent, et le planet ou tu veux le envoyer


[08-Feb-23 03:23 AM] ApexChat#8127
**Domicius**:	finalment, tu choisis le prix.


[08-Feb-23 03:24 AM] ApexChat#8127
**Domicius**:	Mais il faut que tu as le license PRO pour faire des contrats


[08-Feb-23 03:27 AM] ApexChat#8127
**Domicius**:	Si tu fais le contrat au Marche Locale, tu peux aussi choissir si les produits vont etre disposer automatiquement. Sinon, il faut que to les disposes toi meme quand le contrat est accepte


[08-Feb-23 03:28 AM] ApexChat#8127
**Domicius**:	Finalement, le contrat cree un Paquet de livraison dans le inventoire du planete de origini (si les produits existent, evidement).


[08-Feb-23 03:48 AM] ApexChat#8127
**62**:	Merci, mais c'est pour les contrats de lalliance.


[08-Feb-23 03:53 AM] ApexChat#8127
**62**:	voil le contrat CONT 9B2QJ4G


[08-Feb-23 03:55 AM] ApexChat#8127
**Domicius**:	Je ne peux pas le voir.


[08-Feb-23 03:55 AM] ApexChat#8127
**Domicius**:	Mais ca doit etre la meme chose, sauf que tu choisi qui va apporter votre produits. Lui va etre le "partner"


[08-Feb-23 03:57 AM] ApexChat#8127
**Domicius**:	Le "condition" c'est pour changer les valeurs de produit et le prix, le "condition" c'est le numero des jours


[08-Feb-23 03:57 AM] ApexChat#8127
**Domicius**:	parodn le "parameter" pour les jours

**Lehanat**:	hey I'm new here and I was wondering is it worth to just by carbon and hydrogen to make poly-ethylene or should I make something else


[01-Aug-23 04:41 AM] ApexChat#8127
**Inforiel**:	Eyo - depends on a lot of things, like consumables, how much fuel you burn while flying to collect, etc. Only way to be really sure is to crunch the numbers for yourself


[01-Aug-23 04:43 AM] ApexChat#8127
**Inforiel**:	Generally it's not hard to make a profit, but when starting out you either want to track down items that seem very stable or that have currently highest returns


[01-Aug-23 04:45 AM] ApexChat#8127
**Inforiel**:	Comes down to playstyle - If you prefer slow but steady, might want to switch planet and go for someplace with agri- or manufacturing focus , Phobos has been switched to electronics by the player base


[01-Aug-23 04:46 AM] ApexChat#8127
**Inforiel**:	If you are willing to invest more time and keep on track with the shifts of market, anywhere could work since you'd likely be switching what you focus on producing and mixing across markets for max profit initally

[05-Sep-23 08:37 PM] ApexChat#8127
**jelutz77**:	Pick something trading high volume to start, like OVE. Make it a while, make some money at it, expand until the base is full. Don't bother extracting your own stuff on this planet; try doubling production instead to speed things up. Consider moving manufacturing to Heph to take advantage of the COGC there; maybe you can find another operation for this base that can help as well at that point.


[05-Sep-23 08:38 PM] ApexChat#8127
**jelutz77**:	And especially with manufacturing, if you're not extracting your own, watch your input and consumables costs.


[05-Sep-23 10:30 PM] ApexChat#8127

Is it worth switching my base over to electronics production, or would it be better to rebuild somewhere else?  I'm open to any type of production but care most about the rate of return vs investment cost.

[05-Sep-23 11:48 PM] ApexChat#8127
**Archiel**:	Phobos is an electronics planet (that's the way the Chamber of Global Commerce votes), but that's a very difficult starting point.


[05-Sep-23 11:48 PM] ApexChat#8127
**Archiel**:	Most of the intermediates for electronics aren't sold on the CX, they are instead consumed directly and turned into governor upkeep items, like MHP, or turned into spaceship parts, which have very large complicated chains


[05-Sep-23 11:49 PM] ApexChat#8127
**Archiel**:	Incidentally, OOG does offer grants to players with pro who start (or move to) antares space, so if you end up liking the game, sticking around, and getting pro, message me :)


[05-Sep-23 11:51 PM] ApexChat#8127
**Archiel**:	The nearby planet Hephaestus has a manufacturing COGC, so you might eventually transition to that if you are continuing manufacturing.

**Cherrybark**:	Insula... Etherwind, between Antares & Benten but a little closer to Benten, is a great place to make DW and every worker requires DW.  Start with balance of RIG to extract H2O and FP to process into DW.  Grow your 500 area base then consider moving FP to a new base on nearby KW-602c.  Etherwind COGC is Resource Extraction and 602 is Food Processing.

[07-Sep-23 05:08 PM] ApexChat#8127
**Roh**:	meh, I'd argue that you really don't have shortages.


[07-Sep-23 05:12 PM] ApexChat#8127
**Roh**:	most commodity markets here have no price ceilings, along with most of the agri-export listings being surplus markets. You essentially get a intermediary commodity market which relies on price averages from subsidiary markets which are "made-up", and it leads to not only made-up margins, but also to margin-hoarding on the ask orders at the CX.


[07-Sep-23 05:13 PM] ApexChat#8127
**Roh**:	if there was an actual shortage, you'd be hard pressed to find any C at any ask rates, via either the CXes, or the LMs.

[02-Oct-23 02:33 PM] ApexChat#8127
**WiredSlumber**:	Any advice for a new player starting on this planet?


[02-Oct-23 03:08 PM] ApexChat#8127
**Churaviis**:	Sell all your FTL fuel and most of your STL fuel and use it to buy another production building in whatever industry you're specializing in


[02-Oct-23 03:08 PM] ApexChat#8127
**WiredSlumber**:	i see this planet is bonused for electronics, i assume that is more complex production


[02-Oct-23 03:09 PM] ApexChat#8127
**Churaviis**:	Yes, electronics is not recommended for new players as there are no low tier production buildings and everything else is low volume and doesn't sell much on the CX. That does free you up to pursue whatever industry you want


[02-Oct-23 03:10 PM] ApexChat#8127
**WiredSlumber**:	Are there any products I could be making with BMP that would be helpful in electronics manufacturing


[02-Oct-23 03:14 PM] ApexChat#8127
**WiredSlumber**:	Also is this planet focused on electronics because of silicon ore on it, is it worthwhile to mine that here


[02-Oct-23 03:16 PM] ApexChat#8127
**Churaviis**:	Phobos is super close to the CX so just focus on what you can sell there for the most profit. You'll need to do some math to figure out what that is and it will change based on many different factors. For example, PE is expensive but so is the carbon needed to make it.


[02-Oct-23 04:00 PM] ApexChat#8127
**Lanshara**:	you can take up any industry you like, there are no restrictions. The industry you picked when you started gives you the basics for that industry but most people will try several as they advance before settling on their preferences

[18-Oct-23 12:08 PM] ApexChat#8127
**jelutz77**:	The only things that happen with a starting package are that you get 2 experts in a particular field for your first base, and it selects the fabs for particular buildings for that specialty. Otherwise, you can grow as you wish. 2 experts don't even take long to get. However, if you're really behind because you have the fabs for the wrong buildings and your cash is invested improperly for what you now want to do, or something, you can COLIQ to start over.

**Volixit**:	Hello, new dude here. I placed an order for 20 units of water but I'm a bit confused as to how I go about actually getting it. Do I have to wait for it to be shipped or something?

[04-Nov-23 12:59 AM] ApexChat#8127
**lukeskye**:	How's it going? I am a new manufacturer and trying to decide what industry to choose.


[04-Nov-23 12:59 AM] ApexChat#8127
***Lousy** left.*


[04-Nov-23 01:02 AM] ApexChat#8127
**Pacific982**:	Pretty good.  Market's a bit slow for us producing rations, but that's the life of a farmer I guess.


[04-Nov-23 01:38 AM] ApexChat#8127
**Pacific982**:	As far as I'm aware, manufacturer's typically import their resources at the start, so you might need to do a bit of digging on the market to find something profitable.  I'll see what I can find.


[04-Nov-23 01:38 AM] ApexChat#8127
**Pacific982**:	There's a large market for PE right now, though the cost of carbon is a bit on the high side.  You'll still make about 600 credits per work order.  That's option 1 that immediately sticks out.  Give me a few more minutes to find some other options as well.  Can never hurt to have options.


[04-Nov-23 01:38 AM] ApexChat#8127
**Pacific982**:	There's MCGs which will bring in about 687 per batch.


[04-Nov-23 01:38 AM] ApexChat#8127
**Pacific982**:	There is one more, but I'm hesitant to say it on a public channel for fear that the opportunity will disappear when the bigger companies take notice.


[04-Nov-23 01:38 AM] ApexChat#8127
**lukeskye**:	Thanks for the info. For PE and MCGs, is the cargo space factored into your number? I read that fuel is a big cost in the beginning.


[04-Nov-23 01:38 AM] ApexChat#8127
**Pacific982**:	Those two items are meant to be transferred easily.  It's less an issue of cargo space and more an issue of how long between shipments to market.


[04-Nov-23 01:38 AM] ApexChat#8127
**Pacific982**:	PEs are only .01 t and .01 m, so you can fit 50,000 on your starting ship.


[04-Nov-23 01:38 AM] ApexChat#8127
**Pacific982**:	for reference you make them in batches of 200.


[04-Nov-23 01:38 AM] ApexChat#8127
**lukeskye**:	Okay, I think I will go with PE then.


[04-Nov-23 01:38 AM] ApexChat#8127
**Pacific982**:	MCGs weigh .24t and have .1 m so they're limited by weight. you can carry 2,083 of them.


[04-Nov-23 01:38 AM] ApexChat#8127
**Pacific982**:	If you're worried about fuel costs, then try doing what I do and pick up a shipment contract to fill in the excess space.  They often cover the price of transport and can even just give you fuel outright.


[04-Nov-23 01:38 AM] ApexChat#8127
**lukeskye**:	Okay.


[04-Nov-23 01:38 AM] ApexChat#8127
**Pacific982**:	I typically try to make a trip each week to make sure I cash in those contracts. It adds up fast early on.


[04-Nov-23 01:38 AM] ApexChat#8127
**lukeskye**:	Is it worthwhile to collect resources (rig, extractor, collector)?


[04-Nov-23 01:38 AM] ApexChat#8127
**lukeskye**:	In the early game, buying prefabs


[04-Nov-23 01:38 AM] ApexChat#8127
**Pacific982**:	eventually.  depends on how you want to manage your company really.  No "one size fits all" sort of deal with this game.  I will say though, this sector always has a market for carbon and silicon, so it could be worth investing if you have the cash, if only to save on some of the cost.  I personally recommend carbon, since it is a major factor in the cost of your PE.


[04-Nov-23 01:38 AM] ApexChat#8127
**Pacific982**:	Though, now that I say that... I suppose in your case that would just be an incinerator to save on worker space.


[04-Nov-23 01:38 AM] ApexChat#8127
**Pacific982**:	All in all depends on the resource.


[04-Nov-23 01:38 AM] ApexChat#8127
**lukeskye**:	I think I will get a rig to help with farming


[04-Nov-23 01:38 AM] ApexChat#8127
**Pacific982**:	That will overall save you some money on production costs.  It does take a bit of cash to start up so be ready for that.


[04-Nov-23 01:39 AM] ApexChat#8127
**lukeskye**:	I see.


[04-Nov-23 01:40 AM] ApexChat#8127
**Pacific982**:	that will probably save you about 400 per carbon, if you just use the incinerator, or nearly 500 if your willing to set up the whole chain. Keep in mind, that's in materials per work order.  Accounting for rations and drinking water... probably savings of 250 per work order.


[04-Nov-23 01:41 AM] ApexChat#8127
**Pacific982**:	Still, adds up.


[04-Nov-23 02:48 AM] ApexChat#8127
**Pacific982**:	However, a word of warning, a lot of manufacturers make the mistake of trying to control the means of productions for everything, and forget to calculate the cost of feeding the workers and setting up the facilities and end up bankrupting themselves.  A calculator and patience will be your best friends in this game.


[04-Nov-23 02:48 AM] ApexChat#8127
**Pacific982**:	That's why I mentioned carbon, due to the massive discrepancy between the price of production and the price of buying from the market.


[04-Nov-23 02:48 AM] ApexChat#8127
**lukeskye**:	Hmm... do you use spreadsheets to keep track of all these prices?


[04-Nov-23 02:48 AM] ApexChat#8127
**Pacific982**:	Not yet, though I do plan on setting them up soon.  At the moment I check the prices directly then account for roughly what offers will still be open in a week's time.


[04-Nov-23 02:48 AM] ApexChat#8127
**Pacific982**:	It takes about 5 or 6 minutes between each price check.  That's how I figured out it roughly takes 60 credits per ration that I make entirely from parts I source myself.


[04-Nov-23 02:48 AM] ApexChat#8127
**Pacific982**:	That's a rough calculations based on weekly production, fuel expenses per trip, the price of basic water (which I source for my rigs) and subtract the rations consumed in the process.


[04-Nov-23 02:48 AM] ApexChat#8127
**lukeskye**:	Are all transactions between players, or are some provided by the game?


[04-Nov-23 02:48 AM] ApexChat#8127
**Pacific982**:	If you open the order book and see a market maker entry with an infinite number of orders, that is the game provided one which helps structure the market.  Then the faction contracts are also the game.  Everything else is players.


[04-Nov-23 02:48 AM] ApexChat#8127
**lukeskye**:	Got it. Anything else I should know? I've been looking for a game like this for a while. Thinking of designing my own space trading game as well.


[04-Nov-23 02:48 AM] ApexChat#8127
**Pacific982**:	I can't really think of anything else at the moment.  If you ever need any help, there's this chat or the global one, though the global one might not be relevant to our commodity exchange.


[04-Nov-23 02:48 AM] ApexChat#8127
**lukeskye**:	Okay, thanks for your help.

***sginga** left.*

**Pacific982**:	Its on the exact same commodity exchange, and he set the price high enough that those goods aren't going to be sold for months, effectively trapping goods in the market while starving smaller companies.  As a result people have to start paying more or sacrifice valuable building space to produce it themselves.

[10-Nov-23 11:32 AM] ApexChat#8127
**Insula_Crisium**:	@Pacific982 Interstellar Gaia is a competitor of mine. We're both spread traders- we buy low and sell high on the same commodity at the same CX. I hope you're not implying that spread trading is inherently manipulating the market. It IS true that some people do spread trading and try to manipulate the market. Someone did that with RAT.AI1 a couple months back and inflated the prices up to about 140 AIC, but they failed to maintain a permanent price fix. But most of the activity I've seen from Interstellar Gaia is not that, just trading for goods within the well-established price ranges.


[10-Nov-23 11:58 AM] ApexChat#8127
**Insula_Crisium**:	Spread trading, when done without trying to manipulate, is good for the market. It decreases the bid-ask spread, which means that players wanting an instant sale have a more favorable price. It also increases price stability by adding more buy/sell orders to the CX.


[10-Nov-23 11:58 AM] ApexChat#8127
**Insula_Crisium**:	I don't know the RCO market though, so I'm not sure whether that activity was manipulative, but at first glance his activity seems within the normal price ranges.

[10-Nov-23 10:55 PM] ApexChat#8127
**Churaviis**:	A trade doesn't occur until a buy and ask at the same price are placed. If you want it right away then place a buy order at the price of the lowest cost ask order.

***Once_ler** joined.*


[10-Nov-23 10:55 PM] ApexChat#8127
**VoxZer0**:	isn't the lowest cost ask order for like bidding and stuff?


[10-Nov-23 10:55 PM] ApexChat#8127
**Churaviis**:	In order to trade, two players must agree on a price. If no one agrees with your price, no trade can occur

**HARDTOKILL**:	I am already set up, producing PE and MCG. Is place orders on the local market cheaper than flying to the exchange for input resources and consumables.


[25-Dec-23 02:49 AM] ApexChat#8127
**Numsgil**:	there aren't any orders on the Phobos local market currently.  If there were, you'd need to have a PRO account to buy/sell there.  They generally aren't cheaper than the CX, it's more a way to give people spot resources if they're low or to do trades with other players.  Most of the time you'll be buying and selling from the CX

[16-Feb-24 12:03 PM] ApexChat#8127
**Insula_Crisium**:	I've been importing thousands of units of carbon into the ANT CX the past few weeks. Hopefully that has helped bring prices down. Usually they're higher in ANT than some other regions. It's win-win, because I get some trading profits from it, while prices stay lower due to extra supply. Glad to hear it sounds like it's working.

[12-May-24 09:39 AM] ApexChat#8127
**rahzo**:	Hey everyone. I was wondering what everyone produces here? Just trying to get a grasp on the future


[12-May-24 09:54 AM] ApexChat#8127
**Churaviis**:	The COGC here gives a bonus to electronics, but that's a small industry and only really useful at more advanced stages. As such, newer players will run all sorts of different industries. If it's your first planet, feel free to experiment with whatever you want, just be sure to pick something with a big enough market to be able to sell your product quickly


[12-May-24 10:08 AM] ApexChat#8127
**rahzo**:	I was figuring that was the case with the COGC. Thanks for explaining that. I went with Carbon Farmer just cuz I saw a decent demand


[12-May-24 10:10 AM] ApexChat#8127
**Churaviis**:	Carbon farmer is a good choice


[12-May-24 10:11 AM] ApexChat#8127
**rahzo**:	Now i just gotta figure out the best recipe to use or combo


[12-May-24 10:15 AM] ApexChat#8127
**Churaviis**:	Farms take up a lot more space than incinerators, so the slower recipe is usually better as it optimizes for area, which will be the limiting factor fairly quickly

**rahzo**:	I didnt think of Area but I did see the return on the HCP being the best overall

[13-May-24 10:12 AM] ApexChat#8127
**rahzo**:	Bad or extra slow? What makes it bad?


[13-May-24 10:18 AM] ApexChat#8127
**Churaviis**:	It's slower in that the COGC planetary bonus doesn't apply to an industry that newer players have access to, meaning you don't get that extra efficiency boost. That does make it better in that you can experiment with any industry, or even multiple industries, because you aren't locked into a single one, making it a great place to experiment, fail and then start somewhere else more optimized for your new plan once you've learned from your failures, as often happens at least once with newer players.

[22-Jun-24 10:56 AM] ApexChat#8127
**Gauss33**:	Hello i'm new, what are some steps i should take after the tutorial? my idea was build a prefab mk1 so i can keep expandingg my base


[22-Jun-24 11:08 AM] ApexChat#8127
**LapsedNortonSubscription**:	You should consider COLIQing(restarting) and being a farmer. It'll likely allow you to expand more efficiently than if you made prefabs yourself


[22-Jun-24 11:08 AM] ApexChat#8127
**LapsedNortonSubscription**:	aka COLIQ and go to Promitor


[22-Jun-24 11:09 AM] ApexChat#8127
**LapsedNortonSubscription**:	Doing construction on Phobos isn't desirable due to it's production buff being in a different industry


[22-Jun-24 11:09 AM] ApexChat#8127
**LapsedNortonSubscription**:	and because you can always come back here later when you want, where as you cannot ever settle a planet like Promitor unless you start there


[22-Jun-24 11:11 AM] ApexChat#8127
**HushPup**:	Why's that?


[22-Jun-24 11:12 AM] ApexChat#8127
**LapsedNortonSubscription**:	Prom is in a tier of planets SO desirable that the available space on the planet is completely filled


[22-Jun-24 11:12 AM] ApexChat#8127
**LapsedNortonSubscription**:	and it's filled to a degree that it will never open up again


[22-Jun-24 11:12 AM] ApexChat#8127
**LapsedNortonSubscription**:	the only way to circumvent that is by starting the game on the planet


[22-Jun-24 11:12 AM] ApexChat#8127
**HushPup**:	except new players are granted a slot?


[22-Jun-24 11:12 AM] ApexChat#8127
**LapsedNortonSubscription**:	yessir


[22-Jun-24 11:12 AM] ApexChat#8127
**HushPup**:	gotcha


[22-Jun-24 11:13 AM] ApexChat#8127
**HushPup**:	ok thanks


[22-Jun-24 11:15 AM] ApexChat#8127
**Gauss33**:	how does one COLIQ


[22-Jun-24 11:16 AM] ApexChat#8127
**LapsedNortonSubscription**:	open a new buffer -> type COLIQ


[22-Jun-24 11:17 AM] ApexChat#8127
**LapsedNortonSubscription**:	Prom options are Victulalalr(farmer) and Carbon guy(make carbon, a staple resource)


[22-Jun-24 11:17 AM] ApexChat#8127
**Gauss33**:	ok, going


[22-Jun-24 11:17 AM] ApexChat#8127

[04-Jul-24 01:57 PM] ApexChat#8127
**Churaviis**:	The election for Phobos has started. There is one governor and 4 member of parliament offices open for election. We currently have 10 players running for them. I am glad for the competition to keep me on my toes and it makes me want to be an even better governor even though I've accomplished so much already. I would be remiss in my duty, however, if I didn't warn everyone running of the complexities of Phobos governance. If it is not the most complex planet to govern in the galaxy then it is among the most complex. Not only is it high tier, but it has a large high-tier population and requires many niche upkeep materials that cannot be easily found on an CX in the quantities needed at a reasonable price. For this reason, I have had to dedicate significant portions of my operation to produce these upkeep materials myself, perhaps multiple permits.


[04-Jul-24 01:57 PM] ApexChat#8127
**Churaviis**:	For this reason I recommend that anyone that is new to the game, to governance, or who is not willing to dedicate multiple permits to providing upkeep for Phobos, should withdraw from the election and find a simpler planet on which gain experience. Voters should also take these considerations into account when making their decision of who to vote for.


[04-Jul-24 01:57 PM] ApexChat#8127
**Churaviis**:	In addition, I believe that whoever is elected governor should be the one to provide the upkeep materials. Not only will they be the one recieving all the glory and credit for the success of Phobos but they are the ones the voters chose. I'm certain that voters will recognize all that I have done for Phobos and re-elect me to continue the success we've had. If not, however, I will be repurposing my permits and passsing the responsibility for the upkeep of Phobos to whoever the voters choose after an appropriate transition period.


[04-Jul-24 01:58 PM] ApexChat#8127
**Churaviis**:	As such, I believe that all nominees should state whether they believe they are able and willing to provide the upkeep should they become Governor. I recommend against running for governor here if you already have other mid or high tier planets to manage. I myself will not be governor of any other high or mid tier planets so that I can focus on Phobos. I recommend that voters steer clear of anyone who does not confidently state that they are able and willing to focus on providing what Phobos needs.


[04-Jul-24 01:58 PM] ApexChat#8127
**Churaviis**:	This is more important given that the part of the game that needs to be balanced the most is upkeep and infrastructure. When that happens, which will hopefully be soon, the governing of Phobos will be impacted more than most and having a governor that can focus on Phobos and figure out the changes smoothly will be even more important.


[04-Jul-24 01:58 PM] ApexChat#8127
**Churaviis**:	Thank you for your support Phobos

[06-Jul-24 10:54 PM] ApexChat#8127

[06-Jul-24 10:54 PM] ApexChat#8127
**RiseofFilth**:	There, you can click "Antares Station Warehouse" and rent some space


[06-Jul-24 10:54 PM] ApexChat#8127
**RiseofFilth**:	Each rent/click gets you 1 unit of 500 space


[06-Jul-24 10:54 PM] ApexChat#8127
**RiseofFilth**:	I recommend clicking a few times :)


[06-Jul-24 10:55 PM] ApexChat#8127
**RiseofFilth**:	After that, you can check your contracts, the bar on the left side lists "CONT"


[06-Jul-24 10:55 PM] ApexChat#8127
**RiseofFilth**:	If you ever buy something on the CX and you dont have enough space in your CX inventory, it will create a contract to hold onto the items


[06-Jul-24 10:55 PM] ApexChat#8127
**RiseofFilth**:	You just have to open the contract and deliver the item

**RiseofFilth**:	Let me rephrase, the new upgrades are intended to reduce the monthly upkeep costs. Avoiding staying into heresay, I'll simply say, cheaper a simpler to produce inputs for our POPI will ensure that there is never a disruption in inputs, which could cause a shortage and lack of fulfillment, and a gap in population growth in a time when there are open jobs.

**Zibeb**:	One thing that might be helpful, any buffer or tile you look at should have the Buffer command next to the title. So for instance, if I look at this buffer, I see COMG pl-zv-307d, which is private group (COMG) and the planet identifier for Phobos.

[20-Sep-24 05:42 PM] ApexChat#8127
**RiseofFilth**:	Like on many planets, the main detraction of FES's as a upkeep method is that it locks you into using them and being unable to take advantage of any other program. This makes a government overall less flexible when it comes to addressing population shortages or rapid growth.


[20-Sep-24 05:43 PM] ApexChat#8127
**RiseofFilth**:	Additionally... There are 3 types of happiness. "True" Happiness, which is the weekly hidden value of happiness as a result of fulfillment and unemployment. There is the weighted happiness that you see on POPR each week, that is calculated on a weighted scale from the previous 4 weeks "


[20-Sep-24 05:44 PM] ApexChat#8127
**RiseofFilth**:	"true happiness". The most recent week is most relevant and heavily weighted, 4 weeks back is least weighted. And then FES Happiness. This happiness is always an flat addition to the weighted happiness that you see each week on popr.


[20-Sep-24 05:48 PM] ApexChat#8127
**RiseofFilth**:	The problem with FESs as an upkeep method is that the planet's weighted happiness is only upkept by fulfillment and unemployment. When you reduce fulfillment levels because you are using FES, the weighted happiness gets stuck at a much lower place, say 20% of where it should be to maintain a population. If we ever wanted to run any other program that is not FES, the weighted happiness would be without that 20% and would take almost a month to undo the suppressed/lowered state that it is in. And all the while, that low happiness for week after week would cause a massive population crash across all pop types.


[20-Sep-24 05:49 PM] ApexChat#8127
**RiseofFilth**:	Further, when you use FES as an upkeep method, your ability to influence high-end pop happiness is greatly reduced, because of the way fulfillment capping works. It is much more difficult to influence and target specific pop types, like SCI and ENG, for growth, without massively bloating PIO/SET numbers


[20-Sep-24 05:50 PM] ApexChat#8127
**RiseofFilth**:	And the more those numbers become bloated, the more the fulfillment we try to put in becomes diluted across tons of unemployed workers, which means we have to put in even more fulfillment.


[20-Sep-24 05:53 PM] ApexChat#8127
**RiseofFilth**:	Ultimately, I think you are likely correct in that in pure monitary terms, we could likely sustain the population as we are now. But the flexibility and available tools to encourage growth when needed would be stripped away from us. And at the end of the day, this planet generates a lot of money, and my personal opinion is such that I would rather spend a little more in exchange for having greather population management flexibility.


[20-Sep-24 05:54 PM] ApexChat#8127
**RiseofFilth**:	That being said, happy to listen to opinions if people are passionate one way or the other.

[21-Sep-24 05:49 AM] ApexChat#8127
**Roh**:	Planetary maths strictly involves harmonic oscillating differentials.... https://youtu.be/kLWXLbciobw?t=12

{Embed}
Khan Academy Physics
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=kLWXLbciobw&start=12
Equation for simple harmonic oscillators | Physics | Khan Academy
In this video David explains the equation that represents the motion of a simple harmonic oscillator and solves an example problem. Created by David SantoPietro.

Watch the next lesson: https://www.khanacademy.org/science/physics/mechanical-waves-and-sound/harmonic-motion/v/period-dependance-for-mass-on-spring?utm_source=YT&utm_medium=Desc&utm_c...
https://images-ext-1.discordapp.net/external/04EkA4Qv9vUBncZbLAH8DNbPCAkFNEkZpo1OzDcDSu4/https/i.ytimg.com/vi/kLWXLbciobw/maxresdefault.jpg


[21-Sep-24 05:49 AM] ApexChat#8127
**Roh**:	Each type of management tool, be they POPI (SSTs, INFs....), or Programs (Festivities,...), applies a given magnitude to that base fluctuation.


[21-Sep-24 05:50 AM] ApexChat#8127
**Roh**:	That fluctuation is calculated in-game, statisitcally, so you have a span of 5 weeks, wherein true happiness gets averaged out based on fulfilment levels.


[21-Sep-24 05:53 AM] ApexChat#8127
**Roh**:	However the overall behavior of POPRs, largely fits that wave motion, if certain requisites are met. I've mentioned before that there's an "education centipede" in other places. Most of the POPR loss is usually seen from PIO--> SET+ education, and subsequent migration, since most planets are in states of equilibrium, wherein an employed base of workers, per tier, is kept, while the rest simply go away.


[21-Sep-24 05:57 AM] ApexChat#8127
**Roh**:	Those requisites are modulated with long-term POPI levels (of the planet's choosing). Add more POPI upkeep, and you will have a higher bar of fluctuation; have less, and you will have problems. What you end up with is a cycle, wherein pop tiers migrate in, and then migrate out. Education happens automatically, so you have a second set of POPR fluctuations... PIOs or whatever get uptiered, fill the unemployment reserves per POPI models, and then start to migrate out, in magnitude, until the true happiness levels go under said buffer levels, when they start to mass again.

[26-Sep-24 09:10 PM] ApexChat#8127
**RiseofFilth**:	Hey Phobos, just wanted to check in with you all as we have another election cycle on our hands. I hope everyone, from the new players (Welcome to the game, dont forget to check out the main PRUN community discord https://discord.gg/vwcUJx8HHP as well as the ADI discord that offers grants and advice to new players https://discord.gg/N6bXSuvbuw ) to the older players like myself, is doing well this fall.  I just wanted to offer 2 thoughts to voters this cycle. First off, my complete satisfaction and approval of the current goverment. Arch, Aries, Scorpy, and Rogue have all been good PMs and I am satisfied with the direction, the grants, the upkeep, and the population growth for Phobos. Id be happy to see them all be returned to Parliament for future cycles.


[26-Sep-24 09:10 PM] ApexChat#8127
**RiseofFilth**:	My second thought is, while I support folks campaigning for a seat in Parliament if they are passionate and want to contribute and help ensure Phobos is run smoothly, I would like to warn voters against voting for candidates that do not advertise their position, who do not talk, and who are not seriously willing or able to contribute, as Phobos is probably the most consequential planet in all of Antares and deserves attentive and cooperative MPs.


[26-Sep-24 09:10 PM] ApexChat#8127
**RiseofFilth**:	Specifically, Xepiov. For those of you on multiple planets across Antares, you see this name pop up quite a bit on various planet elections. To offer my perspective, I have never seen this person talk in chat. Ive never seen his name on the community discord. Ive never heard his voice. Ive never met anyone else who has actually managed to get a response or had a conversation with this person. What I have seen is his heavy handed and wasteful contributions to small planets he is able to get elected on, like SE-866e. [21-Jan-25 01:39 PM] ApexChat#8127
**eminence32**:	when you look at a contract, there is a column for "party".  if that column is empty, that means that you have to do the thing listed in the "condition" column.


[21-Jan-25 01:39 PM] ApexChat#8127
**eminence32**:	if the "party" column has someone else's name there, that means the other party has to do the thing on that line


[21-Jan-25 01:40 PM] ApexChat#8127

[21-Jan-25 02:11 PM] ApexChat#8127
**Zenton8787**:	I did see on the main site page is that you can do a fair bit of stuff in this game beyond resource extraction and processing


[21-Jan-25 02:12 PM] ApexChat#8127
**eminence32**:	i wrote up a guide of new players in the Benten system (which isn't this system.  Phobos is in the Antares system), but it talks about a lot of important things like costs-of-goods-manufactured and the chamber of global commerce


[21-Jan-25 02:13 PM] ApexChat#8127
**eminence32**:	so you might want to take a look (and just ignore all the stuff that says "welcome to Katoa") https://docs.google.com/document/d/10qdF6wEpZshm-ErQmjyELfjcDpuXh4ZJjlB_1Wcibk4/pub


[21-Jan-25 02:15 PM] ApexChat#8127
**eminence32**:	but the very very short summary is:  when deciding what to do, you should be aware of how profitable (or unprofitable) it will be.  and certain planets have bonuses that make them more profitable to do certain types of industry.   you don't have to chase maximum profits, but it's an important mechanic to the game to be familiar with


[21-Jan-25 02:16 PM] ApexChat#8127
**Zenton8787**:	thats fair


[21-Jan-25 02:16 PM] ApexChat#8127
**Zenton8787**:	for instance when looking at the star map I saw there was a star with an "ICe Mine" or something like name to the planet. which was I think a 100% water plant


[21-Jan-25 02:17 PM] ApexChat#8127
**eminence32**:	anyway while you read that, the answer to what to do next is mostly "what would be fun to do".  some players try to be as self-sufficient as they can, by making everything they need themselves.   other players focus in one just 1 material or 1 industry, trying to become the biggest producer of that item in the universe


[21-Jan-25 02:17 PM] ApexChat#8127
**Zenton8787**:	so that would be a great one to get a build on if I wanted large amounts of water for something.. I dont know if food needs water to grow


[21-Jan-25 02:18 PM] ApexChat#8127
**Zenton8787**:	I guess the thing that I find most fun for me is transportation


[21-Jan-25 02:18 PM] ApexChat#8127
**eminence32**:	yep!  you can build farms on fertile planets, or you can build hydroponics to grow things.  both require water.


[21-Jan-25 02:19 PM] ApexChat#8127
**eminence32**:	ahh, there are some players to do that, too.  warning:  it's hard.  the game is missing some key features to make the lives easier for logistics companies.  but it can be done.   you'll need a PRO license in order to build more ships


[21-Jan-25 02:19 PM] ApexChat#8127
**Zenton8787**:	ah


[21-Jan-25 02:20 PM] ApexChat#8127
**Zenton8787**:	for now Ill stick with the free license to get my feelers in the game


[21-Jan-25 02:20 PM] ApexChat#8127
**eminence32**:	smart


[21-Jan-25 02:20 PM] ApexChat#8127
**eminence32**:	it's the best way to get a feel for the game


[21-Jan-25 02:20 PM] ApexChat#8127
**Zenton8787**:	as well as work on building up my start


[21-Jan-25 02:22 PM] ApexChat#8127
**Zenton8787**:	COGM is a hard thing for me to wrap my mind around but I get the idea.. but the exact numbers are a bit hard


[21-Jan-25 02:22 PM] ApexChat#8127
**Zenton8787**:	specially when everything is written in acronym


[21-Jan-25 02:22 PM] ApexChat#8127
**eminence32**:	yes, there are a lot of acronyms in this game :)


[21-Jan-25 02:23 PM] ApexChat#8127
**eminence32**:	the basic idea of COGM is:   how much does it cost me to make a thing?  once you know that, you can compare it to how much you could buy it on the CX (in case it's a material you need) or how much you can sell it for (in case you're trying to sell it for profit)


[21-Jan-25 02:25 PM] ApexChat#8127
**Zenton8787**:	I guess its kinda a cost of living for the workers + there salaries (cost to make the material) that determains the base cost of the good you wanna sell


[21-Jan-25 02:25 PM] ApexChat#8127
**eminence32**:	yes.  each building requires workers to run.  and those workers requires consumables (food, water, tools, etc)


[21-Jan-25 02:26 PM] ApexChat#8127
**eminence32**:	so even if you're pulling stuff directly out of the ground (like your extractors), you have to provide the consumables for your workers, and that will cost you something


[21-Jan-25 02:26 PM] ApexChat#8127
**Zenton8787**:	and in the case of my Pioneers, Caffinated Infusions.. Yay coffee. my kinda people


[21-Jan-25 02:26 PM] ApexChat#8127
**eminence32**:	yep


[21-Jan-25 02:27 PM] ApexChat#8127
**Zenton8787**:	atm I have low living costs since Im new but I can see where this could grow


[21-Jan-25 02:27 PM] ApexChat#8127
**eminence32**:	to use the typical 3-letter code:  COF is not considered an "essential" consumable, so you don't need to provide it.  but if you do provide COF, your workers will work faster.  this means you can produce more stuff per day, which decreases your costs


[21-Jan-25 02:28 PM] ApexChat#8127
**Zenton8787**:	I just use it as my example cause I like coffee.. but yes, RAT and DW are essential


[21-Jan-25 02:28 PM] ApexChat#8127
**Zenton8787**:	and OVE


[21-Jan-25 02:29 PM] ApexChat#8127
**eminence32**:	the other thing to know is that your production buildings (like your extractor) will slowly degrade overtime, making them slower.  you'll need to repair them with materials.  but don't worry about this now, you don't have to deal with this for at least 2 months


[21-Jan-25 02:30 PM] ApexChat#8127
**eminence32**:	but this also adds to the cost of producing goods


[21-Jan-25 02:30 PM] ApexChat#8127
**Zenton8787**:	so IRL degradation time aswell


[21-Jan-25 02:30 PM] ApexChat#8127
**Zenton8787**:	I did see the repair button on my list of buildings


[21-Jan-25 02:38 PM] ApexChat#8127
**Zenton8787**:	2 days from benton isnt that bad I guess. I was looking at things in a neighbor star cluster but ofc I am still unsure what to produce yet


[21-Jan-25 02:39 PM] ApexChat#8127
**eminence32**:	i should also mention that some people like to fly out into the middle of absolute nowhere and try to survive.  i've never been brave enough to try that :)


[21-Jan-25 02:39 PM] ApexChat#8127
**Zenton8787**:	the true survivalists


[21-Jan-25 02:40 PM] ApexChat#8127
**Zenton8787**:	how do you build onto a planets population?


[21-Jan-25 02:42 PM] ApexChat#8127
**eminence32**:	you need to build up the "population infrastructure" on a planet, which are buildings that can support certain worker types


[21-Jan-25 02:42 PM] ApexChat#8127
**Zenton8787**:	would those be like the HABs the tutorial told me to make for my pioneers


[21-Jan-25 02:43 PM] ApexChat#8127
**eminence32**:	no.  HABs are buildings for your base.  but planetary buildings are something different


[21-Jan-25 02:43 PM] ApexChat#8127
**eminence32**:	open up a new buffer with this command:   POPI ZV-307d


[21-Jan-25 02:43 PM] ApexChat#8127
**Zenton8787**:	ok


[21-Jan-25 02:44 PM] ApexChat#8127
**eminence32**:	this will show you the infrastructure buildings for Phobos.  for example, there are 9 "Safety Stations"

**Archiel**:	Hello citizens of Phobos! On behalf of your parliament and government team, thank you for your support in the recent election. We've been working together behind the scenes to put together an upkeep plan.


[25-Feb-25 03:39 PM] ApexChat#8127

[25-Feb-25 03:39 PM] ApexChat#8127

[25-Feb-25 03:41 PM] ApexChat#8127
**Archiel**:	The core plan establishes the cheapest possible minimum upkeep- keeping satisfaction above 50% is required to prevent loss of population, which can happen quite quickly when it drops below that level. Currently we have a sizable deficit of scientists- despite solid growth in the population, the job demand has continued to grow, so I'd like to move aggressively to close this gap up.


[25-Feb-25 03:41 PM] ApexChat#8127
**Archiel**:	Education can be effective in the 50%-70% range, but if the POPI materials are available, we may go a bit higher in the short term.


[25-Feb-25 03:43 PM] ApexChat#8127
**Archiel**:	I've sent my first two 2k/2k ships of POPI mats up, and since some key materials including PFE/OLF/SOI are in short supply on the market, I will be upgrading the PAR a bit to help with comfort, and ensure the culture and education doesn't get capped.


[25-Feb-25 03:43 PM] ApexChat#8127
**Archiel**:	If you produce OFF, HOG, PFE, SOI, OLF, HAB and can sell directly to me at a decent price, please reach out. There's also room for DEC, HD, and HOG.


[25-Feb-25 03:44 PM] ApexChat#8127

**Harkenn**:	How do worker assignments work? If I have a building that isn't in use, will its workers move over to another one that isn't fully staffed?


[14-Apr-25 12:14 AM] ApexChat#8127
**Finest_One**:	If the building is built its "in use" besides that Population will redistribute on the planet for everyone every pop Cycle. You can see the planets Pop Cycle by clicking on the Workforce Population # in the planet menu or just using Code POPR (planet ID)
